column6:
Location: Siegburg, NW, DE, 53721
Family. Global. Siegwerk. Bring color into the world and help us make the packaging industry sustainable and digital. We are a global family company that produces innovative, high-quality inks and offers you exciting tasks, great colleagues from all over the world and space for your own ideas. Become a Siegwerker and experience Ink, Heart and Soul!

Location: Alfred-Keller-Straße 55, 53721 Siegburg

Your Tasks:

You are responsible for our reporting in the largest region EMEA.
In this regard you develop our reporting system and consider if automation and/or simplifications are possible.
You support budget and forecast processes and ensure high data and process performance in terms of time and quality.
You are EMEA key user for a workflow tool to coordinate investment requests.
In close cooperation with the regional CFO you prepare various ad hoc analyses and edit the data accordingly.
You prepare documents and presentations for management meetings and contribute to various finance projects.
You are a contact person for colleagues in controlling and sales and support them regarding customer and product data.

Your Profile:

Based on your bachelor degree or a comparable qualification you have gained initial experience in finance or controlling.
You have a strong understanding of numbers and a good analytical capacity and you love to deal with various business issues.
You are confident with using MS-Office, especially Excel and Power Point, and have good SAP skills.
You work independently and on your own responsibility and you have good communication skills in English.

What we offer:

Flexible working hours and remote work
Attractive renumeration
Diverse tasks in a family atmosphere and global environment
Space for your personal development
Good traffic connection both by public transport (job ticket available) and by car
In-house canteen and inner-city location with restaurants and shops

Your Contact:

Should you have any further questions, Svenja Schomburg looks forward to your call! You can reach her via phone 02241 304 8819.

Job ID: 22107

Please use our online platform to apply for this position. Job applications via mail or e-mail will not be accepted.

Responsibilities
You will always work together with the industry-specialized Senior Analysts, Client Relationship Managers and/or specialized Business Lines. Thereby your main tasks will be:
You will perform a complete Corporate Credit Analysis (Business Profile, Counterparty Description, Activity and Operations, Market and Industry Assessment, Peer Group Comparison, Counterparty Strategy, Management, Financial Analysis including Cash Flow Projections, Outlook).
An appropriate internal Obligor Rating reflecting the counterparty’s creditworthiness will be determined by you.
You will apply a wide range of financial transactions for all kinds of counterparty credit limits needed for execution.
Providing a decision recommendation to the respective decision-makers, as well as swift answers to their questions is another part of your job.
You will follow-up on the approval process until final validation, as well as on the evolution of SG’s exposure to specific clients, taking into account commercial (profitability) as well as risk considerations.
Dealing with potential changes is also part of the job.
Profile required
Graduate with a Master degree from Business/Engineering school or University, majoring in Business Administration, International Business or Finance
A previous experience in Investment Banking would be appreciated
You are fluent in English and have a good level in German
You are proficient in Office application
Skills :
Assessment of counterparty credit risk is the heart of our role within SG.
Drawing the right conclusions from available information is essential to succeed in our role.
Our daily work is heavily depending on usage of MS Office applications (e.g. to draft credit application) and proprietary software (to retrieve internal exposure data).
To facilitate the examination of your application by our English-speaking managers, we thank you for applying in English.
This VIE in Frankfurt is to begin as soon as possible but you need to plan 3 months between your application date and the beginning of your VIE assignment. It will last 18 months.
The VIE is a specific contract, under Business France’s eligibility criteria, opened to candidates under 28 and from the member states of the European Economic Space. For further information, please see Mon VIE-VIA Business France.
We would like to draw your attention to the fact there that your VIE mission could potentially get postponed, depending on the evolution of the health crisis and subjects to the decision made by the Crisis and Support Centre of the Ministry of Europe and Foreign Affairs (MEAE). In addition, the selected candidate will only be paid upon confirmation from Business France and arrival in the country of assignment.
Why join us
As soon as you arrive, you will be integrated into our teams and will learn every day alongside our experts, who will support you in your tasks. Gradually, you will become more independent in your projects, making this experience a real career accelerator. You will also discover all the diversity of our businesses, in a sector that is constantly evolving and innovating.
At the end of your VIE, various opportunities could be offered to you, in France and abroad.
Business insight
At Societe Generale, we are convinced that people are drivers of change, and that the world of tomorrow will be shaped by all their initiatives, from the smallest to the most ambitious.
Whether you’re joining us for a period of months, years or your entire career, together we can have a positive impact on the future. Creating, daring, innovating and taking action are part of our DNA.
If you too want to be directly involved, grow in a stimulating and caring environment, feel useful on a daily basis and develop or strengthen your expertise, you will feel right at home with us!
Still hesitating?
You should know that our employees can dedicate several days per year to solidarity actions during their working hours, including sponsoring people struggling with their orientation or professional integration, participating in the financial education of young apprentices, and sharing their skills with charities. There are many ways to get involved.
We are an equal opportunities employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.
Reference: 21000PY3
Entity: SG CIB
Starting date: immediate
Publication date: 2021/12/08

Job Description

We are currently looking for a Junior Security Analyst who is eager to learn and join our Information Security Team.
Our Security Team ensures that customers of our online shop have a safe shopping experience and their personal data is secure with us. In addition, the team also protects our corporate data and the hardware of our employees. Protecting customer and company information is an important part of our business and our team is passionate about bringing security to the next level. Our goal is to create a secure environment without restricting or slowing down business processes.
We are looking for a Junior Security Analyst who is passionate to work on security-related topics and wants to build up knowledge in security monitoring, threat hunting and security event management.

What you will do
Triage vulnerability reports submitted through our bug bounty program
Investigate and respond to security alerts in our systems
Participate in employee security awareness training
Improve our monitoring and scanning tools to detect security issues and automate routine tasks
Keep an eye on current threats in the cyber security space and implement preventative measures within the organization.

Who you are
You have some background in Computer Science, IT Administration and/or Security.
You are able to write scripts and programs to automate tasks
You are able to process large quantities of information from multiple sources, like emails, logs, Slack alerts, etc.
You are familiar with Linux and/or Windows OS.
You have good communication and presentation skills, you can explain technical terms in non-technical language.
Fluent English skills (spoken & written)

Benefits
Grow together with one of the fastest growing eCommerce companies in Europe
Flexible working times
40% discount on our online shop
Fresh fruits + drinks everywhere
Language courses (German & English)
Free sports courses & reduced price for gym membership
Subsidized public transportation ticket
Free choice of hardware and operating system (Mac, Windows, Linux) also for private usage
State-of-the-art tech stack running on AWS
Modern office in the city center of Hamburg
International working environment and English as company language
Company flats (subject to availability)
Agile work environment (MOVE) and cross-functional teams
Free access to Germany’s greatest developer conference code.talks
Free Laracasts and Egghead account
Help in relocation and VISA process

YOU ARE THE CORE OF ABOUT YOU.
We take responsibility for creating an inclusive and exceptional environment where all genders, nationalities and ethnicities feel welcomed and accepted exactly as they are. We believe that a diverse workforce essentially contributes to the ABOUT YOU culture. In order to maintain talent and diversity, we emphasize the care for physical health, mental health and overall well-being. Our values and work ethics essentially contribute to our brand mission: empower acceptance and shape an inclusive, fair and circular fashion culture.

We are looking forward to receiving your application – preferably via our online application portal! Thus, we can ensure a faster process and for you it is very easy to upload your application documents. :-)

selbstständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise

Konnten wir Sie für diese anspruchsvolle Aufgabe begeistern?
Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt mit einer aussagekräftigen Bewerbung über den Button „Online bewerben“.
Ihr Ansprechpartner:
Yannick Weis
Debeka-Hauptverwaltung
Ferdinand-Sauerbruch-Straße 18
56073 Koblenz
Telefon (02 61) 4 98 – 14 69
yannick.weis@debeka.de

At super.AI, we are building services to enable AI/Machine Learning technologies for the masses. We are at the exciting stage where the growth of our company forces us to do aggressive hirings to realize our visions quicker. We are a group of ex-Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and MIT engineers and data scientists who spent the last 2 years creating the new programming interface for AI.

What you'll do:
You'll generate lists of potential AI use cases and leads for specific verticals, for specific job titles, in specific companies (tied to verticals, companies, job titles, the economic value of the problem, TAM, etc.)
You'll analyze industry reports, set up meetings to understand the markets, talk to current customers, talk to people within super.AI, etc.
Create compelling validation and proof with the sales team to build out a compelling hypothesis and scalable machine
Interpret and research emerging trends involving various companies
Excellent knowledge of quantitative and qualitative data.

What we are looking for:

Smart, humble, hardworking, and collaborative
By smart we don't necessarily mean high IQ (although a huge plus), but an affinity toward learning. We want to automate as much as possible so we can focus on the few things that require human intelligence and creativity.
By humble we don't mean submissive or unambitious, we mean it in the same way Roger Federer is humble.
By hardworking, we don't mean long hours (be with your family). What we mean is while you're here you're doing the best work of your life. It means being disciplined, professional, focused, gritty, resilient, and resourceful.
By collaborative, we don't mean submissive or deferential, it means taking leadership from everywhere. "I'm taking responsibility to fix this system", if there's a lack of trust "I'm going to address it" if goals are unclear "I'm going to deal with it", it's about being a meritocracy
All four of the above are required. We all know people missing one of these and it's not nice to work with them (e.g. someone who is smart and hardworking but not humble and collaborative).
Paradoxical
The people we like the most are smart but humble
Wants to win no matter what, but will not cross lines of integrity to get there
Strong beliefs weakly held, etc.


Requirements:

Working toward or graduating with a degree in/related to AI/ML, economics, math, statistics, or business.
Previous experience in data organization, analysis, and reporting
Detail-oriented, driven, and tenacious.
Strong writing and communication skills.
Results-oriented, great at multi-tasking, and being creative
Ability to work in a fast‐paced sales environment. You think out-of-the-box and wow people with your unique perspective and quality work.
Experience using Microsoft Office products, especially Excel and PowerPoint
Experience with group discussion and collaboration

About the company
Aroundtown SA is the largest listed commercial real estate company in Germany, with an investment focus on real estate in the German and Dutch real estate markets. Aroundtown invests in commercial and residential real estate which benefit from strong fundamentals and growth prospects. The commercial properties are held by AT and in addition Aroundtown holds a substantial interest in Grand City Properties S.A. ("GCP"), a publicly traded real estate company that focuses on investing in value-add opportunities in German residential real estate markets.

We strengthen our teams in different areas of the company. For support we are looking for you at our location in Berlin at the earliest possible time as a

Business Analyst (m/f/d)

Your mission
Business data mining and rent role analysis
Financial analysis and modelling: Producing performance analysis for the management based on actual results and constructing financial projections
Monitoring and analysis of corporate credit ratings
Analysis of equity research reports
Competition Analysis
Project-related analytical and administrative support
Due to the international affiliation of the company, the daily communication takes place in English
Your profile
At least a BA in a business related degree
Initial experience in a similar position
Practical experience and profound Excel knowledge and strong skills in other MS Office Programs
Very good written and spoken English
Team player with fast learning skills
Entrepreneurial thinking and acting with "hands-on-mentality"
Confident appearance with high motivation and commitment to the team
What we offer
A modern, gender-friendly open door policy and communication culture "per Du", as well as flat hierarchies
ongoing knowledge enhancement is supported by our online training offers in the company's own learning portal, as well as individual training measures
we value respectful cooperation at eye level, as well as a multicultural corporate environment
"Fit for the day or after work" thanks to free use of our professionally equipped fitness center at the Berlin headquarters (incl. exciting course offerings and trainers)
Job ticket, meal allowance for the newly designed canteen restaurant with a wide range of options (including vegan)
Possibility of spectator visits to Bundesliga games of Union Berlin, our heart club. We are proud to be a sponsor!
We actively promote the combination of family and career and find individual solutions in the organization of working hours
support with childcare through our partner Voiio
A wide range of employee offers with varying special conditions in the areas of media, fashion, leisure, furnishings and much more round off our range of services
How to apply?
Do you have a strong drive to succeed?
We look forward to your written application in English stating your earliest possible starting date and your salary expectations.

Im Rahmen der direkten Personalvermittlung suchen wir aktuell für unseren Kunden aus dem Dienstleistungssektor einen Datenanalysten in Duisburg oder München. Dank unserer vertrauensvollen Kontakte zu Personalentscheidern vor Ort ist Randstad Ihr Sprungbrett in diese attraktive Position.

Auf die Plätze, fertig, los! Der Startschuss für Ihre Online-Bewerbung bei Randstad ist gefallen. Immer sehr willkommen sind uns Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung, die die Voraussetzungen der Stellenbeschreibung erfüllen. Wir freuen uns, Sie alle mit einem Netzwerk von über 500 Niederlassungen und besten Firmen-Kontakten in Ihren neuen Job zu begleiten. Top-Unternehmen und vielversprechende Bewerber zusammenzubringen, ist unsere Stärke als größter Personaldienstleister Deutschlands. Überzeugen Sie sich selbst und bewerben Sie sich jetzt online. Können Sie sich ein besseres Sprungbrett in die Festanstellung vorstellen?
Das dürfen Sie erwarten
Direkte Personalvermittlung in eine Festanstellung bei unserem Kundenunternehmen
30 Tage Urlaub, inklusive am 24.12., 31.12. jeweils ein halber Tag und Rosenmontag
Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge sowie für den ÖPNV
Möglichkeit der Nutzung eines Car- & Bike-Leasings
Flexible Arbeitszeiten dank Gleitzeitregelung sowie mobiles Arbeiten 4x die Woche, 1x die Woche Bürotag
Vielseitige Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten mit (Inter-)nationale Karriereperspektiven
Unterstützung im Familienleben
Vergünstigte Sportangebote und Betriebssport
Ihre Aufgaben
Zuständigkeit für die Entwicklung, Implementierung und den Betrieb von Reports
Hands-on Mitarbeit an der Implementierung eines Scoring-Verfahrens
Ansprechpartner für die Fachbereiche bei datenbasierten Fragestellungen
Korrespondenz mit Vertretern verschiedener Geschäftsbereiche
Stetige Weiterentwicklung von produktivitätsbezogenen Kennzahlen, Reports und Analysen in enger Absprache mit angrenzenden Bereichen
Verantwortung für die Erstellung von Monatsreports für die Personal Finance Zentrale mit Sitz in Frankreich
Erstellung von ad-hoc Analysen sowie automatisierte Reports als elementare Ergänzung der operativen Steuerung
Unsere Anforderungen
Abgeschlossenes Studium mit Schwerpunkt MINT oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften
Einschlägige Berufserfahrung im genannten Aufgabenfeld
Ausgeprägte Analyse- und Synthesefähigkeit
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Erste Kenntnisse in Scoring sowie in SQL, Excel, bestenfalls VBA und sowie in Python
Ausgeprägte Eigeninitiative, Kommunikationsstärke und Teamfähigkeit
Hohe Eigeninitiative, sorgfältige Arbeitsweise und klare Zielorientierung
Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte zu durchdringen

- job post
column6:
Data Analyst*
Business Intelligence, Data Analytics
#yourmission
Erstelle für unsere Kunden individuelle BI-Lösungen mit Microsoft Data Platform & Analytics oder Qlik Sense/QlikView Applikationen
Hebe den Datenschatz unserer Kunden für Analyse und Prognose ihrer Geschäftsprozesse
Verarbeite diese Daten zu Informationen und finde die geeignete Form Insights zu visualisieren
Setze Kundenprojekte selbständig und eigenverantwortlich um
Beantworte und löse laufende Anfragen deiner Kunden und führe Trainings durch
#yoursuperpowers
Informationstechnische oder betriebswirtschaftliche Ausbildung
Mindestens 3 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung, selbständige und verantwortungsbewusste Arbeitsweise
Begeisterung für Zahlen, Daten, Analyse und Visualisierung
Kenntnisse im Bereich Business Intelligence und Datenbanken (SQL)
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Microsoft PowerBI, AzureML, Python, AzureDataLake, Dynamics365 oder mit Qlik
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
#beternasuperpowers
Mentoring-Partner während der Einarbeitungsphase
Moderne Arbeitsbedingungen auf Basis flexibler Arbeitszeiten
Spannende und herausfordernde Projekte in unterschiedlichen Branchen
Fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung inklusive Zertifizierungen
Internationales Arbeitsumfeld
Unsere Projekte sind vielfältig - unser Team ist einzigartig! BE-terna zählt mit 920 Mitarbeitern und 25 Standorten zu den größten europäischen Anbietern von Business-Lösungen. Mit Begeisterung für modernste Softwaretechnologien unterstützen wir unsere Kunden, einfacher und transparenter zu arbeiten. Wir bieten Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten in spannenden Projekten, in denen Teamarbeit großgeschrieben wird. Mehr zu uns und unserer Kultur findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.
Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt? Dann drück auf den Apply now Button und innerhalb von nur ein paar Minuten hast du dich schon bei uns beworben. Möchtest du mehr zum gesamten Einstellungsverfahren wissen? Dann klicke hier.

column2:
Junior Data Analyst m/w/d
- job post
column6:
Du glaubst an die Kraft von Daten? Du hast Lust dich immer wieder neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen, verborgende Zusammenhänge und neue Erkenntnisse aus Daten zu generieren und so deinen persönlichen Mehrwert bei uns zu leisten? Gestalte bei MARC O’POLO den digitalen Wandel in agilen und innovativen Teams mit und erlebe die hohe Dynamik im Bereich Digital Intelligence. Zeig uns, was wir von dir lernen können. Wir sind gespannt! Ein motiviertes Team freut sich, mit dir weiter zu wachsen.
Deine Aufgaben
Du analysierst große, komplexe und mehrdimensionaler Datensätze eigenständig, leitest zuverlässige Erkenntnisse ab und lieferst so Geschäftsleitung und Fachabteilungen eine valide Basis für ihre strategischen Entscheidungen
Du transformierst komplexe, analytische Zusammenhänge in einfache, verständliche und effektive Insights und Handlungsempfehlungen und kommunizierst diese überzeugend im Unternehmen
Du erstellst eigenständig Dashboards und Reportings für verschieden Stakeholder und bist verantwortlich für die Erfassung ihrer Anforderungen
Du begleitest alle Phasen der Modellentwicklung in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Data Engineers und Data Scientists, um damit den Erfolg von MARC O’POLO weiter voranzutreiben (z.B. Multichannel-Analysen, Kundenanalysen, Produktentwicklung)
Dein Profil
Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium (Master oder vergleichbar) in Statistik, Angewandter Mathematik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder einem verwandten quantitativen Fachgebiet
Du hast mindestens erste Erfahrung in der Anwendung von Data Analytics zur Unterstützung wichtiger Geschäftsentscheidungen (z.B. Business/Product/Marketing Analytics, Business Intelligence)
nice to have: du verfügst über Erfahrungen in der quantitativen Forschung
Du beherrscht den Umgang mit Datenvisualisierungstools (Erfahrung mit PowerBI ist ein Plus)
Du punktest mit einem soliden Methodenwissen in Statistik
Du hast eine sehr schnelle Auffassungsgabe, sehr gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten und bist sehr sicher im Umgang mit Zahlen; mehr noch: du blickst positiv in eine Zukunft, die von Daten und künstlicher Intelligenz geprägt sein wird
Du hast solide Grundkenntnisse in SQL und idealerweise erste Erfahrungen mit Programmiersprachen z.B. R oder Python gesammelt
Du stellst höchste Ansprüche an die Qualität, Sinnhaftigkeit und Ethik deiner Arbeit und willst Teil einer stetigen und stringenten Entwicklung eines gewachsenen und wachsenden Unternehmens sein
Du bringst Eigeninitiative und eine Hands-on-Mentalität mit und hast Lust in einem dynamischen Umfeld ein Team aus hilfsbereiten, ambitionierten Nerds mit deinem Wissen und deiner Persönlichkeit heterogen zu ergänzen
Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Dein HR Kontakt
Stella (Brießmann) - Human Resources
Hast Du offene Fragen? Gerne beantworte ich Dir diese telefonisch unter: +49 8036 90-1783

This is MARC O’POLO
FOLLOW YOUR NATURE – Sich selbst treu bleiben. Gestaltungsfreiraum, flache Hierarchien, ein menschliches Miteinander und ein dynamischer, skandinavischer Spirit bilden die Arbeitsatmosphäre bei MARC O’POLO. Werde ein Teil der MARC O’POLO Story und starte Deine Karriere mit uns.

column2:
Production Engineer Data Analyst
- job post
column6:
The Production Engineer Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing, troubleshooting and addressing technical issues as well as developing tools and solutions for process improvement for the preparation, set-up and maintenance of the production environment. The person fulfilling this role will work in close collaboration with our multi-site Engineering and Testing team, Quality and Logistics department as well as our Contract Manufacturer.

Your Responsibilities
Design and develop tools for automation for yield and process analysis
Perform other general duties such as querying data, linking data to Tibco Spotfire and other tools, general spreadsheet, and presentation of the work
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets that could be valuable for diagnostics and predictive analysis efforts. Recognize variations/deviations to create value from data
Data mining to understand/demonstrate/measure completion and stimulation performance
Work with multi-site teams to develop, refine and scale data management and analytic procedures, systems, workflows
Your Skills and Experience
Bsc. degree in Math, Information Technology, Computer Science or Engineering
Experience in data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Knowledge in data analysis (extracting, correcting, analyzing) by using statistical methods
Knowledge of MySQL, PostgreSQL database systems. Querying data, linking data to other tools
Knowledge in programming languages (Python, R or similar)
Strong analytical skills with ability to collect, and disseminate significant amounts of information (high-volume, high-dimensional big data from varying sources) with attention to detail and accuracy
Good communication skills
Used to work independently and precisely
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
Ability and willingness to travel our contract manufacturers' sites.
Hold a valid work permit for applied location.
What are your perks?
A multicultural and international company with over 50 different nationalities
Project-based activities working with colleagues distributed across the globe
A start-up and innovation mindset while in the process of scaling-up processes and efficiencies
Learn more about u-blox and its mission by watching this video !

We see diversity as a strength and promote a culture of inclusion among our employees. Our varied backgrounds, ideas and experiences are critical to our success. We strive to become a strong learning organization and are committed to provide our employees with equal opportunities regardless of differences such as gender, race, ethnicity, generations, belief.


Applications Close Date

Contact
Are you interested in this challenging position within an international work environment in a successful company? Apply now! You will be working with a motivated team in an exciting technology.

We are looking forward to receiving your application.

As the Pricing Data Analyst, you will be a dedicated Data Analyst for Pricing platform initiatives at Zalando and contribute to high impact initiatives directly improving the way we set prices on >500K articles for more than 39 million customers in 20 countries. As part of a cross-functional team, you help to maximise impact with our dedicated four-digit million euro annual discount investment. You will build a deep understanding of how pricing decisions during and outside sales events impact our customers' behaviours, purchase patterns and customer lifetime value. You independently perform analytical tasks and own projects within your team and transform data into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic and operative decisions.
You will be part of a broader team of 10 analysts, with learning and mentoring opportunities as well as a larger community of analysts across Zalando.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Understand our customers' behavior by developing ad hoc and regular analysis & statistical models on customer and transactional data to support driving optimal pricing decisions and customer value. Share results & visualizations in automated reports.
Deliver and present actionable insights. Identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the pricing strategy. Become a trusted advisor to your stakeholders and our senior management.
Formulate easy-to-understand recommendations based on strong analytical insights to get stakeholder buy-in.
Drive data mindset in the team and guide in terms of methodology & technology. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Foster an inclusive & diverse team environment
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
2+years of experience in Analytics, answering business questions with model driven statistical analysis.
Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Advanced Skills in data methodologies and technologies (SQL + Python). MicroStrategy & Tableau are considered as a plus. Curious about learning new technologies.
PERKS AT WORK
Join a welcoming, diverse team that takes work-life balance and mental health seriously. Part-time contracts are possible, parents of young children are explicitly encouraged to apply.
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 34 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

column2:
Junior Data Analyst - Pricing (m/w/d)
- job post
column6:
In dieser Stelle hast du die Möglichkeit, als Junior IT Pricing Analyst (m/w/d) in die Welt der IT einzusteigen und deine analytischen Fähigkeiten selbstständig einzubringen. Mit dir zusammen möchten wir das Thema Pricing nachhaltig vorantreiben.
Was du bewirkst
In dieser Rolle unterstützt du die Optimierung und Weiterentwicklung der Pricing Prozesse und Pricing Tools.
Dein Aufgabengebiet erstreckt sich von ersten pragmatischen Analysen via Excel bis hin zu automatisierten Berichten mit OLAP TM1 Datenbanken.
Auf Basis deiner Analysen entwickelst du Entscheidungsgrundlagen für erfolgreiche Pricing-Initiativen.
Du etablierst eine kontinuierliche Erfolgsmessung für die Pricing-Initiativen, um unseren Wachstumsbeitrag sichtbar zu machen.
"Last but not least" arbeitest du eng zusammen mit den Kollegen aus dem BI- und SAP-Team, wenn es um die Aufbereitung großer Datenmengen aus unterschiedlichen Datenquellen (bspw. Data Warehouse oder SAP) geht.
Das bist du
Du bist bekannt für deine ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit sowie Hands-On-Mentalität mit einer großen Liebe zum analytischen Detail. Um sicherzustellen, dass du in deinem Job auch erfolgreich bist, suchen wir zudem nach:
Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Erste relevante Erfahrungen im Bereich IT oder Datenanalyse, idealerweise mit Schwerpunkt Pricing.
Kenntnisse in SAP sowie TM1 sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS-Office (v.a. Excel) setzen wir voraus - ebenso wie solide SQL-Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen mit einem Tool (MS Power BI, Cubeware Cockpit oder Cubeware Importer)
Sehr gute Erfahrungen in mind. einer Programmiersprache (bspw. VBA oder Java)
Das macht uns besonders
Unsere Mitarbeiter sind der Schlüssel dazu, unsere Vision zum Leben zu erwecken. Basierend auf dieser Überzeugung haben wir Benefits für unsere Mitarbeiter, oder wie wir sie nennen Familienmitglieder, geschaffen:
Wir bieten 30 Tage bezahlten Urlaub im Jahr
Genieße Exklusiv-Rabatte auf ausgewählte Viessmann Produkte und Dienstleistungen
In unserem Mitarbeiterrestaurant bieten wir dir eine Auswahl an gesunden und preiswerten Mahlzeiten, zubereitet aus regionalen Lebensmitteln
Viessmann bietet dir, wann immer möglich, die Option zum mobilen Arbeiten und sorgt für die passende technische Ausstattung
Denke schon jetzt an später und profitiere von unserer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
Kostenlose E-Ladestation – Denn wir denken an die Umwelt und an dich. Ob mit Job Bike oder mit Europcar – unsere Partnerschaften schonen gleichzeitig die Umwelt und deinen Geldbeutel
Das sind wir
Mit mehr als 12.000 Mitarbeitern in 74 Ländern und einem Umsatz von über 2 Milliarden Euro, ist Viessmann ein führender Hersteller von Klima- und Energielösungen. Durch unsere energieeffizienten Produkte helfen wir dabei, eine der größten Herausforderungen unserer Zeit zu lösen: den sparsamen und nachhaltigen Einsatz von Energie. Viessmann geht hier als bestes Beispiel voran: Wir haben unseren CO2 Verbrauch seit 2005 um 70% in unserem Headquarter in Allendorf reduziert und gleichzeitig unsere Effizienz verdoppelt. Aber wie schaffen wir das alles? Zusammen mit unseren Mitarbeitern, Partnern und Kunden.
Jede Stimme ist dabei wichtig, um unsere Innovationskraft kontinuierlich voran zu treiben. Und wir leben von dem unermüdlichen Engagement unserer Teams, gemeinsam auf unser Ziel hinzuarbeiten: Lebensräume für kommende Generationen zu schaffen.
Wir freuen uns von dir zu hören!

Wir bieten Dir:
eine kostenlose Premium Mitgliedschaft für ein GANZES Jahr

kohlenstoffgefiltertes Wasser und eine reichliche Tee-Auswahl

column2:
Data Engineer, Machine Learning & Data
- job post
column6:
Build the world's fastest Identity and Checkout products

Company Mission

Our mission is to make buying online faster, safer and easier for everyone. Fast Login and Fast Checkout enable a one-click sign-in and purchasing experience that makes it easier for people to buy and merchants to sell. The company’s products work on any browser, device or platform to deliver a consistent, stress-free purchasing experience. Fast is entirely consumer-focused and invests heavily in its users’ privacy and data security. Headquartered in San Francisco but open to a globally remote workforce, we are a founders-led, privately held company funded by Stripe, Index Ventures, Susa Ventures and other world-class investors.

Summary

The ML & Data group’s mission is to empower Fast to easily embed machine learning and data in our strategy, decision making, and product experiences so that we can bring value to our customers. On the platform side, this group is responsible for: scaling our online infrastructure to track, measure, and quantify user touchpoints, building a data platform that supports batch and streaming data processing at scale, enhancing our product experiences with experimentation and machine learning infrastructure. On the product side, it is also this group’s core responsibility to build recommendations, search, and other machine learning powered products that can increase engagements with our customers and supercharge Fast sellers with increased revenue.

Our Data Platform team builds foundational infrastructure to enable product analysts, data scientists, machine learning engineers, and product engineers to embed data and machine learning into their decisions, products, and experiences. Our team moves across our technology stack to ensure that we are able to have end-to-end solutions in how we create, track, ingest, transform, and enrich our data. Additionally, we are also responsible for our core machine learning infrastructure and ensuring models can easily be productionalized.

As a Data Engineer at Fast, you will develop large scale batch and streaming data platforms and build real-time data streaming solutions for Fast that is highly available, durable, and provides end-to-end latency guarantee. The team’s mission is to architect, develop, and deploy world-class big data systems to empower every team at Fast to make data-driven decisions and features.
Role
Build data infrastructure, services & frameworks that make data more accessible to Fast developers, services & teams
Design real-time data streaming solution for Fast that is highly available, durable, and provides end-to-end latency guarantee
Utilize the latest breakthroughs in stream transportation technologies, to extract enormous value out of Fast’s data
Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design
Participate in code and design reviews to maintain our high development standards
Requirements
Experience building large scale distributed software systems
Solid understanding of GO for backend / systems software development
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
Nice to have
Prior working experience with FinTech, Payments and Identity
Data visualization skills (R, python, Tableau)
Familiarity with tools for analysis of very large datasets
Full-stack engineers who can work across the backend and frontend
#LI-Remote

Benefits and Perks - Because People Matter

We are committed to diversity and inclusion, and demonstrate our values through equitable pay, fantastic benefits, and access to all reasonable accommodations.

See what Fast can offer you:

Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision insurance (99% paid by Fast)
Globally remote with flexible work schedules and commuter benefits to fit your needs
Generous maternity & paternity leave for all family caregivers
401k match up to 4%
Competitive Salary & Equity
People-focused, unlimited & flexible paid time off
Inclusive events & programs to allow everyone to express their voice (or dance skills)
Monthly exercise, internet & office equipment stipends (and great snack perks)
#LI-remote
